column4: COME ON PEOPLE. There has to be at least one person in here who has at least some idea of what to do. and I *need* to get this thing up and running again/
you need to be patient
how are you accessing the system now?
are you able to edit the configuration for grub 2/
that allows for more flexibility
while you're in the chroot, you may need to run upgrade-from-grub-legacy
some forums has also suggested dpkg-reconfigure grub2
I don't think there is a command for it
those likely use another method (like gnome-panel intercepting the keystrokes and using a dbus call to show the desktop)
look in system > preferences > keyboard shortcuts
it doesn't use a script
or it most likely doesn't
as with a lot of other stuff in gnome, it probably sends a call via DBus to the window manager
or it might use ICCM (ICCCM?) for that
what do you need it for?
I don't think it can be done
it's using the development branding instea of the official branding
only official builds from mozilla should use the official branding
ctrl+alt+esc?
yeah, not sure when it last worked, I know it did in 8.04, and I'm pretty sure about 8.10. 9.04 I dont think so though
don't you mean ctrl+alt+backspace?
I think that was an upstream change by Xorg's developers
probably something about people hitting it accidentally
it can be reenabled
